description.raw:
The name of this branch is a bit of a misnomer, since this particular patch series doesn't actually remove any boost.  However, it does add tests and cleanup a few things which will be nice to have for my continuing boost removal efforts, so I figured I would open this up separately.

* Doble -> Double

* Remove FindOS.cmake.

    It's output isn't used for anything, as far as I can tell.

* Style cleanup in Param_TEST.cc

* Style cleanup in Element.cc

* Add in additional tests for Element.cc

* Implement Element Has* functions in terms of Get* functions.

    This is just better code reuse.

* Slightly improve performance in GetElement/GetAny.

    Previously, we were calling HasElement() followed directly
    by GetElement(), meaning we were iterating over the list
    of Elements twice.  Instead, just call GetElement(); if it
    returns ElementPtr() (i.e. nullptr), then we know that it
    wasn't found and we can try our other strategies.  This
    mostly matters if we have a large number of Elements, but
    there is no reason to do the work twice.

The name of this branch is a bit of a misnomer, since this particular patch series doesn't actually remove any boost. However, it does add tests and cleanup a few things which will be nice to have for my continuing boost removal efforts, so I figured I would open this up separately.

  • Doble -> Double

  • Remove FindOS.cmake.

    It's output isn't used for anything, as far as I can tell.

  • Style cleanup in Param_TEST.cc

  • Style cleanup in Element.cc

  • Add in additional tests for Element.cc

  • Implement Element Has functions in terms of Get functions.

    This is just better code reuse.

  • Slightly improve performance in GetElement/GetAny.

    Previously, we were calling HasElement() followed directly by GetElement(), meaning we were iterating over the list of Elements twice. Instead, just call GetElement(); if it returns ElementPtr() (i.e. nullptr), then we know that it wasn't found and we can try our other strategies. This mostly matters if we have a large number of Elements, but there is no reason to do the work twice.

title: Remove boost 10
